SpecPP 1.0.0

    • Analyzing Lansing Woods data

SpecPP

An R package for spectral analysis of multivariate spatial point patterns in a rectangular region (Ding et al., 2025). Given a multivariate point pattern and a parametric model of the intensity function, this package facilitates the characterization of frequency-domain features from your data through kernel smoothing. It includes functions for bandwidth selection, visualization, and coherence analysis.

Installation

You can install the development version of SpecPP from GitHub with:

# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("qwding101/SpecPP")

Tutorial

This tutorial demonstrates how to use SpecPP to analyze multivariate point pattern data.

References

  • Ding, Q. W., Yang, J., & Shin, J. (2025). Pseudo-spectra of multivariate inhomogeneous spatial point processes. arXiv preprint arXiv:2502.09948.
  • Yang, J., & Guan, Y. (2024). Fourier analysis of spatial point processes. arXiv preprint arXiv:2401.06403.
